title.narrative: Provision of emergency core relief assistance and adequate shelter

description.narrative: This project aims to provide essential shelter and NFI assistance to Mozambican refugees in Malawi. UNHCR will provide 3,000 people with shelter kits which includes materials and supplies needed to allow refugees to design and construct their own shelter. In addition, they will be provided with core relief NFI's and solar lamps to allow access to communal latrines around the camp which is presently unlit. UNHCR will procure and distribute all items within a four month period.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
